titleInfo.title: 'Effects of Zubara [al-Zubārah] dispute on Imports into Qatar from Bahrain'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. File notes appear at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file concerns an enquiry by Shaikh Salmān bin Ḥamad Āl Khalīfah, Ruler of Bahrain, through Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Bahrain Government, regarding whether motor agents to whom dollar credits are given are free to sell their cars to anybody who wishes to buy them, including the Shaikh of Qatar, ‘Abdullāh bin Jāsim Āl Thānī. The file contains correspondence between Belgrave and Cornelius James Pelly, Political Agent at Bahrain.The front and back covers have been reused from closed files and bear the titles: '33/121-i CARRYING OF ARMS BY B.I. VESSELS' (folio 1v) and 'CONFIDENTIAL 79/120 EXPORT OF COTTON FROM GWADUR [Gwādar]' (folio 7r).
